lisflood:
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # report Times Series
# all possible output as time series are listed here # name: name of this variable in the settings.xml # outputVar: name of the output variable in the code # where: where is the time series reported: e.g. gauges, sites, 1, Catchments, LakeSites etc. # repoption: time serie is reported if one of these option is active # restrictoption: time serie is only reported if this option(s) are active # operation: operation to be done before reporting e.g. mapmaximum, total (=catchmenttotal)
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Internal number of sub step for soil, channel routing, water use
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ## SITES # report at Sites - repStateSites # Intermediate state variables at sites
# report at Sites - repRateSites # Intermediate rate variables at sites (all as pixel-average rates in [mm/time step]) # Note on variables ending with "Pixel" suffix: these are all variables that are internally # calculated for permeable fraction of each pixel only. The "Pixel" values are spatial averages, # averaged over whole pixel (to keep them consistent with all other reported rate variables)
#
#
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # GAUGES #repMeteoUpsGauges # Catchment-averaged values of input meteo variables # Each variable is accumulated over contributing area, and then # divided by number of pixels to get average over contributing area # Driving meteo variables # reporting in [mm/time step], no intensities!
#repStateUpsGauges # Catchment-averaged values of model state variables # Each variable is accumulated over contributing area, and then # divided by number of pixels to get average over contributing area
#repRateUpsGauges # Catchment-averaged values of model rate variables # Each variable is accumulated over contributing area, and then # divided by number of pixels to get average over contributing area # all in [mm/time step] # Note on variables ending with "Pixel" suffix: these are all variables that are internally # calculated for permeable fraction of each pixel only. The "Pixel" values are spatial averages, # averaged over whole pixel (to keep them consistent with all other reported rate variables)
#
#
# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Report time series of lakes, reservoirs, polders, wateruse #repsimulateLakes (only for option simulateLakes)
#repsimulatePolders (only for option simulatePolders)
#repwateruse ((only for option wateruse)
#repwateruseSites ((only for option wateruse)
# report PF # repPFSites, repPFUpsGauges
# report LZAvInflow # repLZAvInflowSites, repLZAvInflowUpsGauges
# In
# out
#----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- #----------------------------------------------------------------------------- # Report Maps # all possible output as maps listed here # name: name of this variable in the settings.xml # outputVar: name of the output variable in the code # unit: what unit has this variable e.g. m, mm, degree !!! has to checked!! # end: reported only at last step # steps: reported at report steps # all: reported on all steps # restrictoption: time serie is only reported if this option(s) are active
# Maps of intermediate state variables at selected time steps # Time steps in ReportSteps defined in 'timer section!' # Typically used as initial conditions for succeeding simulation! # no forest [0] forest [1]
# Reporting of "end" maps
#inputmaps # Note differences between in- and output: # PrecipitationMaps: input [mm/day]; may cover whole map area # PrecipitationMapsOut: output [mm/time step], covers mask area only!
# Optional reporting of *individual* model state variables as maps
# Optional reporting of model rate variables as maps # all rates in [mm/time step]
# Runoff maps
# These options report pF and vegetation stress due to low soil moisture
# Earth2Observe maps
# storage lakes river channel floodplains missing # soil moisture missing
# Water Abstraction
